review_text: This place is OK. There are pros (cheaper than the rest, located near where I needed to be and accessible, hosts do their best to provide) but there are also some cons. First, expect to hear anything your neighbors do, paper thin walls are an understatement. Don't even bother doing laundry in the shared public laundry. It's coin fed (hosts provide enough change for two loads) but the machines are from the 80s. Your clothes don't really get clean and they definitely do not get dry. I felt like I was in a 3rd world country with my clothes hanging all over the apt so they could air dry after two cycles in the dryer that failed to dry them. There is awesome water pressure but the drains for the sinks, well they don't drain. I communicated this and getting it fixed must have got lost in the shuffle. review_text: We travel, frequently, and started using platforms, like AirBnB, and others, a few years ago. I carefully vet potential properties, as my standards are high. In all of that time, we have never been privileged to have stayed in a more immaculate private home, than this! It was astounding! From the very first contact, Judy was warm, and communicating. Her home is a spacious, mature home which has been sensitively updated. The decor is warm, and inviting, with plenty of comfy chairs, and gathering spaces. There is a large, inviting deck just off of the sun room, which doubles as a TV room. There are ceiling fans, throughout, which assure that the ample air conditioning gets evenly distributed. If you are musically talented, please bring sheet music, as there is a well tuned baby grand piano, in the living room! There are two bedrooms, the master bedroom featuring a large, lovely sitting room. The bathroom may be accessed, directly from the master suite, and from the hallway, directly across from the second bedroom. That bathroom has been modernized, and offers a nice, deep, bathtub/shower combination, and there are no end of thirsty towels available. Here, as in all areas of the home, there is a wide array of useful guest amenities, in the form of nice smelling shampoos, body washes and toothpaste, among them. That generous spirit carries through, to the well appointed kitchen, where we were pleasantly surprised to see a refrigerator VERY GENEROUSLY stocked with many bottles of water, juices, teas and fresh half and half. There is a Keurig coffee machine, and many pods, of several different types provided. The snack basket is not to be missed! There are dozens of personally sized selections, attractively displayed. Judy, and a friend, graciously met us, upon arrival, after staying in contact with us while we were on the road. She was so warm, that we felt an immediate affinity for her, and felt absolutely welcome, there. We were there, for a family wedding, and only spent two nights. It is a suitable space for long term rental. Let me assure you that, should we ever find ourselves returning, this will be the home we rent. The experience was extraordinary! Thank you, Judy

We enjoyed our stay at Serenity Hill on August 20. The place is as serene as the name implies. The hosts thought of everything to make our stay comfortable - coffee, grab n go snacks, stocked bathroom (make up wipes, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, etc.) and more. I found the place clean and cozy. It served our purposes well as our homebase during an event at Gervasi Winery over the weekend (less than 10 minute drive to the vineyard). They also accommodated our questions and coming and goings throughout our stay. Very friendly and gracious hosts!
Thank you again!
